result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan Cornell Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 08/14/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-4

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's, during period of probation or civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at zero.
- No firearms/weapons 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.  Defendant currently in ALMA.
- Attend and complete parenting classes.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, Jacquelyn M., without Court approval.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children. With mother's consent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan Cornell Robinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Logan Cornell Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Logan Cornell Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO CHARGE: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of18 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
   -- defendant currently in ALMA.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Jacquelyn M., without court approval.   
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
   --- with mother's consent. 
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 8-14-2015 AT 1:30 PM..  
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant Logan Cornell Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO CHARGE: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-8-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Jacquelyn M., no weapons or firearms, and no violation of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Logan Cornell Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-20-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: JACQUELYN M.  
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Logan Cornell Robinson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  
Defendant Logan Cornell Robinson in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
